data.title: University of Geneva, Institute of Teacher Education
data.text:
The University Institute of Teacher Education benefits from a privileged collaboration with the various faculties of the University of Geneva (Humanities, Sciences, Economics and Management, Social Sciences, Law, Psychology and Educational Sciences). Established in 2009, the interfaculty structure offers within the same institute all of the training programs to become a teacher or a school administrator. Since 2009, the University Institute of Teacher Education fulfills a public policy and political mandate ordered by the Grand Council of Geneva. Aiming to provide a high quality training, directly related with academic research, the IUFE’s primary goal is to promote the best conditions to achieve a consistent vision and practice of the teaching profession.

PROGRAMS

The University Institute of Teacher Education combines four different Teacher programs specialized in:

Pre-primary and primary school levels: “Teaching certificate in Pre-primary and Primary Education”

Secondary level I and level II: “Master of Arts in Secondary Education”; “Bi-disciplinary Master of Arts in Secondary Education”

Special needs education: “Master of Science in Special needs Education”

Administration and management of educational establishments: “Certificate of Advanced Studies (CAS) in Administration and Management of educational establishments”; “Diploma of Advanced Studies (DAS) in Administration and Management of educational establishments”; “Master of Advanced Studies (MAS) in Administration of educational establishments and Education policies”.

Furthermore, the Institute is strongly committed in the continuing education offered to the teachers in Geneva.
